UniprotID	Q03405-2
Accession	Q03405;A8K409;Q12876;Q15845;Q16887;Q6IB52;Q9BWT0;Q9NYC8;Q9UD69;Q9UEA6;Q9UM92;Q9UMV0
EntryName	UPAR_HUMAN
ProteinName	Urokinase plasminogen activator surface receptor (U-PAR) (uPAR) (Monocyte activation antigen Mo3) (CD antigen CD87)
GeneName	PLAUR MO3 UPAR
Length	281
Function	Acts as a receptor for urokinase plasminogen activator (PubMed:15677461). Plays a role in localizing and promoting plasmin formation. Mediates the proteolysis-independent signal transduction activation effects of U-PA. It is subject to negative-feedback regulation by U-PA which cleaves it into an inactive form.
Subcellular Location	Cell membrane; Cell projection; Invadopodium membrane; Cell membrane; Secreted
Disorder	
ExposeBuried	
SurfaceAccessbility	
SecondStructure	
Hydropathy	
Polar	
Charge
